arm_group.description: 24 IU Oxytocin, intranasal application 45 min prior to the experiment
Intranasal application, sodium chloride solution, 3 puffs per nostril

brief_summary.textblock:
Mounting evidence indicates that the intranasal administration of the neuropeptide oxytocin
      has prosocial effects. However, the neural substrates of these effects are still unclear.
      The investigators hypothesized that a single dose administration of oxytocin should increase
      empathogenic and affiliative responses and that these effects are mediated by an increased
      insula activity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neural Correlates of Empathogenic and Affiliative Actions of Oxytocin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy male volunteers

          -  In a heterosexual relationship

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Current or past psychiatric disease

          -  Current or past physical illness

          -  Psychoactive medication

          -  Tobacco smokers

intervention.description: 24 IU; 3 puffs per nostril, each with 4 IU OXT

facility.name: Department of Psychiatry, University of Bonn

clinical_study.official_title: Neural Correlates of the Empathogenic and Affiliative Actions of Oxytocin

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Psychiatry University of Bonn

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Ethics Board, University of Bonn

primary_outcome.description: All subjects are scanned while they view emotional and neutral faces and rate their empathy for these stimuli.
primary_outcome.measure: Empathy ratings and their neural correlates
primary_outcome.time_frame: About one hour after the intranasal administration of oxytocin

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: All subjects are scanned while they view a picture of their mate and and an unknown female.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: About one hour after the intranasal administration of oxytocin

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
